title: Cold resistance
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Cold_resistance/ko "Cold resistance/ko")

**Cold resistance** is a fairly important resistance to have. It will protect against most cold attacks and reduce slipping on [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice"). However, most cold attacks will still freeze [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), destroying them.

Cold resistance is fairly easy to obtain through eating [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"). [White dragons](/wiki/White_dragon "White dragon") provide cold resistance, as do most "cold" monsters, like [blue jellies](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly") and [winter wolves](/wiki/Winter_wolf "Winter wolf"). The [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") starts out with intrinsic cold resistance, being from the frigid Northlands, and [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") get cold resistance at XL 13; any character may gain resistance by [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning"). Extrinsic sources of cold resistance include [white dragon scales](/wiki/White_dragon_scales "White dragon scales"), [white dragon scale mail](/wiki/White_dragon_scale_mail "White dragon scale mail"), and the [ring of cold resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_cold_resistance "Ring of cold resistance"), as well as [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand") when wielded.

Monsters that are resistant to cold but not to [fire](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") are considered *vulnerable to fire* and take double damage from [fireballs](/wiki/Fireball "Fireball")[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) and 7 more points of damage from [rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray") of fire.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) This never applies to your character, even while polymorphed.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Sources](#Sources)
- [2 Messages](#Messages)
- [3 External links](#External_links)
- [4 References](#References)

## Sources

Intrinsic cold resistance can be obtained from eating the following corpses and globs:

| Monster                                                       | Conduct    | Difficulty | Chance | Notes                            |
| ------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------- | ---------- | ------ | -------------------------------- |
| [brown mold](/wiki/Brown_mold "Brown mold")                   | vegan      | 2          | 3%     |                                  |
| [gray ooze](/wiki/Gray_ooze "Gray ooze")                      | vegetarian | 4          | 7%     | acidic                           |
| [brown pudding](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding")          | vegetarian | 6          | 7%     | acidic                           |
| [black pudding](/wiki/Black_pudding "Black pudding")          | meaty      | 12         | 7%     | acidic                           |
| [gelatinous cube](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube")    | vegan      | 6          | 10%    | acidic                           |
| [flesh golem](/wiki/Flesh_golem "Flesh golem")                | meaty      | 10         | 12%    |                                  |
| [blue jelly](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly")                   | vegan      | 5          | 13%    |                                  |
| [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon") | meaty      | 23         | 17%    | poisonous, Caveman quest nemesis |
| [winter wolf cub](/wiki/Winter_wolf_cub "Winter wolf cub")    | meaty      | 7          | 33%    |                                  |
| [yeti](/wiki/Yeti "Yeti")                                     | meaty      | 7          | 33%    |                                  |
| [frost giant](/wiki/Frost_giant "Frost giant")                | meaty      | 13         | 33%    |                                  |
| [winter wolf](/wiki/Winter_wolf "Winter wolf")                | meaty      | 9          | 47%    |                                  |
| [ice troll](/wiki/Ice_troll "Ice troll")                      | meaty      | 12         | 60%    |                                  |
| [white dragon](/wiki/White_dragon "White dragon")             | meaty      | 20         | 100%   |                                  |

## Messages

- You feel full of hot air.

  You gained intrinsic cold resistance by eating a corpse or tin.

- You feel warm!

  You gained intrinsic cold resistance by gaining a level.

- You feel cooler!

  You lost intrinsic cold resistance due to level drain or a [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") attack.

- You feel mildly chilly.

  You were frozen, but suffered no damage due to cold resistance.

## External links

- [Eating Corpses For Food And Intrinsics](http://web.archive.org/web/20071018034842/http://www.geocities.com/dcorbett42/nethack/corpse.htm)

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/explode.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 436](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/explode.c#L436)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 3589](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/src/zap.c#L3589)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d3/Nh361-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Cold resistance

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

Cold resistance is a fairly important resistance to have. It will protect against most cold attacks and reduce slipping on ice. However, most cold attacks will still freeze potions, destroying them.

Cold resistance is fairly easy to obtain through eating corpses. White dragons provide cold resistance, as do most "cold" monsters, like blue jellies and winter wolves. The Valkyrie starts out with intrinsic cold resistance, being from the frigid Northlands, and Monks get cold resistance at XL 13; any character may gain resistance by crowning. Extrinsic sources of cold resistance include white dragon scales, white dragon scale mail, and the ring of cold resistance, as well as Frost Brand when wielded.

Monsters that are resistant to cold but not to fire are considered vulnerable to fire and take double damage from fireballs[1] and 7 more points of damage from rays of fire.[2] This never applies to your character, even while polymorphed.

Contents

  • 1 Sources
  • 2 Messages
  • 3 External links
  • 4 References

Sources

Intrinsic cold resistance can be obtained from eating the following corpses and globs:

Monster Conduct Difficulty Chance Notes
brown mold vegan 2 3%
gray ooze vegetarian 4 7% acidic
brown pudding vegetarian 6 7% acidic
black pudding meaty 12 7% acidic
gelatinous cube vegan 6 10% acidic
flesh golem meaty 10 12%
blue jelly vegan 5 13%
Chromatic Dragon meaty 23 17% poisonous, Caveman quest nemesis
winter wolf cub meaty 7 33%
yeti meaty 7 33%
frost giant meaty 13 33%
winter wolf meaty 9 47%
ice troll meaty 12 60%
white dragon meaty 20 100%

Messages

You feel full of hot air.
You gained intrinsic cold resistance by eating a corpse or tin.
You feel warm!
You gained intrinsic cold resistance by gaining a level.
You feel cooler!
You lost intrinsic cold resistance due to level drain or a gremlin attack.
You feel mildly chilly.
You were frozen, but suffered no damage due to cold resistance.

External links

  • Eating Corpses For Food And Intrinsics

References

  1. ↑ src/explode.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 436
  2. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.2, line 3589

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.1. Information on this page may be out of date.

rawPage:
{{languages}}
'''Cold resistance''' is a fairly important resistance to have. It will protect against most cold attacks and reduce slipping on [[ice]]. However, most cold attacks will still freeze [[potion]]s, destroying them.

Cold resistance is fairly easy to obtain through eating [[corpse]]s. [[White dragon|White dragons]] provide cold resistance, as do most "cold" monsters, like [[blue jelly|blue jellies]] and [[winter wolf|winter wolves]]. The [[Valkyrie]] starts out with intrinsic cold resistance, being from the frigid Northlands, and [[Monk]]s get cold resistance at XL 13; any character may gain resistance by [[crowning]]. Extrinsic sources of cold resistance include [[white dragon scales]], [[white dragon scale mail]], and the [[ring of cold resistance]], as well as [[Frost Brand]] when wielded.

Monsters that are resistant to cold but not to [[fire resistance|fire]] are considered ''vulnerable to fire'' and take double damage from [[fireball]]s{{refsrc|src/explode.c|436|nethack=3.6.2}} and 7 more points of damage from [[ray]]s of fire.{{refsrc|src/zap.c|3589|nethack=3.6.2}}  This never applies to your character, even while polymorphed.
